discussion.content:
Passed with 96%, Have additional question. 
What two statements regarding the Virtual Cloud network VCN are true?
•A. A Single VCN can contain both private and public Subnets
•B. VCN is s regional resource that span across all the availability Domains in a Region
•C. You can only create one VCN per region
•D The VCN is the IPsec based connection with a remote on premises location e VCN isa global resource that span across all the Regions
A. A single VCN can contain both private and public Subnets. B. VCN is a regional resource that span across all the availability Domains in a Region
Mine this was wrong, I didn't chose B.

The question says minimal DBA activities, in Exadata the path & update is to be done manually. Hence the answer should be C - Autonomous Database
C most economical. Exadata is expensive

The Database service offers autonomous and co-managed Oracle Database cloud solutions.
Autonomous databases are preconfigured, fully-managed environments that are suitable for
either transaction processing or for data warehouse workloads. Co-managed solutions are
bare metal, virtual machine, and Exadata DB systems that you can customize with the
resources and settings that meet your needs.

Autonomous Database is cheaper than the Exadata
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Database/Concepts/adboverview.htm
"most economical" Answer is C
C is correct

questions.question_text: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) service can be used to protect sensitive and regulated data in OCI database services?

discussion.content: AD is correct

AD: Budgets are set on cost-tracking tags or on compartments (including the root compartment) to track all spending in that cost-tracking tag or for that compartment and its children.
https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Billing/Concepts/budgetsoverview.htm
A and D. Use compartment and tags
A&D correct
A & D is correct answer

questions.question_text: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Budgets can be set on which two options? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Correct Answer: B
Thanks .. I go with B
yes B is the correct Answer.
Good answer

I can't believe that is the B, but the documentation say "for HDFS data"

The Oracle Data Transfer Appliance is another option for data t ransfer when moving data over the wire is not feasible.
Bandwidth or resource constraints might exist on the source cluster, or proximity to an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region might limit FastConnect availability. The data set could also be so large that it would take too long to copy. In these cases, Oracle can send you a Data Transfer Appliance that you can deploy in your data center and use as a DistCp target for HDFS data.
https://docs.oracle.com/en/solutions/learn-migrate-app-data-to-cloud/data-migration-options.html#GUID-6AFE04A7-721F-46BD-AD05-AEBEAA93AF0F
B is correct
Communicate to on-prem: Dynamic routing gateway(virtual router that provides path for private traffic betn VCN & destination other than the internet). To establish it use: IPSec VPN Or FastConnect
B. Data Transfer for data migration

B. is correct, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Data Transfer Appliance securely moves terabytes or petabytes data between on-premise data centers and the cloud. The service reduces data migration times from weeks or months to just hours and is available for data import to the cloud and data export from the cloud

B is correct. DRG is a secure broadband connection between customer premises and OCI. However the question is related to bulk data migration, for which DTA service can be availed. This however is not covered or even mentioned in the Foundations course lectures.
C is the correct answer, why? DRG or Fast connect is recommended to transfer high number of data (not size) while Data Transfer appliance is recommended for Big data (huge size)

C seems right, but looking at OCI literature, B seems where they want to go right away. https://docs.oracle.com/en/solutions/learn-migrate-app-data-to-cloud/data-migration-options.html#GUID-BB44605C-79A9-496A-BC50-16B4FB7BCDD9
C. Dynamic Routing Gateway
B not C DRG is a dynamic Routing Gateway
moving data from on-prem, the answer should be C
B is the most correct

B. 
The Data Transfer Appliance (import appliance) is a high-storage capacity device that is
specially prepared to copy and upload data to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. You request an
import appliance from Oracle, copy your data onto it, and then ship it back to Oracle for
upload.

Ans is B. Data Transfer is an offline data migration service that lets you securely move petabyte-scale datasets from your datacenter to Object Storage or Archive Storage on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
I think is C. DRG is correct
C is correct
